intro: Dresslerella pilosissima, commonly known as the hairy sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming structure with hairy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and they bloom during the warmer months. Dresslerella pilosissima is well adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in areas with limited rainfall.
